servinfo.title: DTC P1875: 4WD Low Switch Circuit Malfunction (Open)

servinfosub.title: Wiring Diagram
servinfosub.ptxt: Refer to DTC P1874: 4WD Low Switch Circuit Malfunction (Short):4 A/T .

servinfosub.title: DTC Detecting Condition and Trouble Area

entry.ptxt: Actual transfer position is 4L although TCM detected low switch is turned OFF with vehicle speed between 29 km/h (18 mile/h) and 88 km/h (55 mile/h). (if equipped with 4L/N switch)

s1.ptxt: Connect scan tool to DLC with ignition switch OFF.
Clear DTCs in TCM and ECM memories by using scan tool.
Start engine and transfer position switch to “4L” position (motor-shift type 4WD model).
Keep engine running at idle speed for 10 seconds or more with select lever “D” range.
Start vehicle and increase vehicle speed to about 50 km/h (31 mile/h) in “4L” position for 2 minutes.
Check DTC, pending DTC and freeze-frame data.

testgroup.title: Vehicle speed signal check

test1.ptxt: Check DTC in ECM, ABS hydraulic unit/control module and ESP® hydraulic unit/control module referring to DTC Check:M16A and J20A , DTC Check and DTC Check .

testgroup.question: Is there DTC P P0500: Vehicle speed sensor (VSS) malfunction in ECM and/or DTC C1021, C1022, C1025, C1026, C1031, C1032, C1035 and/or C1036 in ABS hydraulic unit/control module and ESP® hydraulic unit/control module?

action.ptxt: Go to applicable DTC diag. flow.
Go to A/T System Check:4 A/T .

testgroup.question: Do you have SUZUKI scan tool?

testgroup.title: 4L/N switch and its circuit check

test1.ptxt: Connect SUZUKI scan tool to DLC with ignition switch OFF.
Select “DATA LIST” mode on scan tool.
Check 4L/N switch signal (ON or OFF) on display when turning transfer position switch to each position.

testgroup.question: Is OFF / ON displayed as described above?

action.ptxt: Intermittent trouble or faulty TCM. Check for intermittent trouble referring to Intermittent and Poor Connection Inspection . If OK, substitute a known-good TCM and recheck.

test1.ptxt: Check terminal voltage “E93-4” of TCM connector connected when turning transfer position switch to each position.

action.ptxt: Intermittent trouble or faulty TCM. Check for intermittent trouble referring to Intermittent and Poor Connection Inspection . If OK, substitute a known-good TCM and recheck.

test1.ptxt: Check 4L/N switch for operation referring to Transfer Assembly Inspection:Motor-Shift Type (Transfer with Shift Actuator) .

action.ptxt: 4L/N switch circuit open. If wire and connections are OK, substitute a known-good TCM and recheck.
